definition: to press/to extract (juice)/device for extracting juice, oils etc
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to press/to squeeze/to extract juice, oil etc by squeezing
to extract/to squeeze out (juice etc)/(fig.) to exploit
to extract oil from vegetables/to press
to press (fruit)/variant of 敲詐|敲诈[qiao1 zha4]

sentences.english: The oil is then put into big vats and used for cooking.
sentences.chinese: 榨出來的油就裝在大桶子裏，用來炒菜。

sentences.english: Eventually he pushed her off, and she stumbled towards the winepress.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他把她推開，她一個趔趄，倒向了那臺榨酒機。

sentences.english: The apples were taken away after their seeds were no longer extractable.
sentences.chinese: 當再也榨不出子來時，蘋果就被拿走了。

sentences.english: This is the time of the year when they press their grapes.
sentences.chinese: 這是他們榨葡萄汁的季節。

sentences.english: The blackmailers bled her for every penny she had.
sentences.chinese: 勒索者榨盡她的每一文錢。

sentences.english: He does not want any orange juice at the moment.
To make wine you first crush the grapes.
sentences.chinese: 制葡萄酒得先碾榨葡萄。

sentences.english: Use the skin if you are juicing the fruit.
sentences.chinese: 榨果汁的時候，記得連皮一起哦。

sentences.english: But it is these dregs that are often the most impressive.
sentences.chinese: 不過通常被他們榨出來的東西都很令人印象深刻。

sentences.english: The blackmailers bled him for every penny he'd got.
sentences.chinese: 勒索者榨盡他的每一文錢。

definition: okara (i.e. soy pulp, a by-product of making soymilk or tofu)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
peanut butter/also written 花生醬|花生酱
dashi (soup stock used in Japanese cuisine) (orthographic borrowing from Japanese)
